entry.title: About this blog, part 2
entry.content: I touched briefly on the technology used in this blog in a previous post, but I didn't explain the motivation behind a lot of the choices I made when building it. I'd like to do that in this post.

entry.title: About this blog
entry.content: This blog took a long time to get started. Every time I tried to build it, I wound up focussed on some tech I wanted to use to host it. In the previous iteration, I even wrote a server framework. I took some holiday over the Christmas period, so I decided to throw everything away and make something minimal.

entry.title: Private data for JS classes with WeakMap
entry.content: Private data has always been awkward in JavaScript. It's particularly difficult when it comes to constructors, and with ES2015 recently published, classes too. Let's say we have an example class, exported by an ES2015 module:
